title: So I guess Xpeke is to Origen what Hai is to C9
body: Neither one of them will ever be able to retire.

replies.body: Peke has got years of experience in both domestics play in Europe and International play. Unlike Froggen and Alex he stayed consistent from the "golden age." He is much harder to replace than your run of the mill mid. FNC most likely only got away with it because of how big their org is. Probably have some good talent scouts.
Wasn't Feb like 17 when he was recruited to FNC? That's some good scouting there.

they also got rekkles when he wasn´t even old enough to play and not to mention huni/reignover when they where barly known, and mostly so for losing ("gameover")...their ability to find talent and shape it into a team is really what made them the stand out team for europe throughout the years.

> [{quoted}](name=Don Eulrich,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=gfMh34Gr,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2016-03-11T23:43:43.549+0000)
>
> they also got rekkles when he wasn´t even old enough to play and not to mention huni/reignover when they where barly known, and mostly so for losing ("gameover")...their ability to find talent and shape it into a team is really what made them the stand out team for europe throughout the years.

Yeah, only losing the title once to Alliance, that's quite the run. Even when they didn't finish the split in first, they'd get 1st in the playoffs.
Faker was 17 when he joined SKT
Not as long as <insert other role player here> is in the toilet.
You're talking about Soaz, aren't you?

> [{quoted}](name=Cilllller,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=gfMh34Gr,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-03-11T14:31:55.776+0000)
>
> You're talking about Soaz, aren't you?

No.. For OG I meant Power of Evil...

For C9.. Meteos and (sadly) Bunny Fufu...

All good players but somehow disappointing...

Honestly, Fufu will be fine after Hai trains him a bit.
Meteos was a fine player, but Rush is better, better mechanics, better rotations, etc. 
And honestly, Soaz is just tilted, it pains me to say it, but he needs to be benched, as well and PoE

> [{quoted}](name=Cilllller,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=gfMh34Gr,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-11T18:30:31.012+0000)
>
> Honestly, Fufu will be fine after Hai trains him a bit.
> Meteos was a fine player, but Rush is better, better mechanics, better rotations, etc. 
> And honestly, Soaz is just tilted, it pains me to say it, but he needs to be benched, as well and PoE

I still have faith in Soaz, but he's definitely tilted, and might need time on the bench.
Pull a C9 and move Peke up to top lane xD

> [{quoted}](name=Cilllller,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=gfMh34Gr,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-11T22:45:12.797+0000)
>
> Pull a C9 and move Peke up to top lane xD

Soaz is really inconsistent and I still think POE is good enough to be OG mid
I don't think that Xpeke intended to retire just wanted to take some time off. I think he was originally planning on taking off the whole split but I guess he came back early.
xPeke didn't want to play any longer and only sub if needed.  He wants to be a coach/manager for the team and only work behind the scenes.

See, for me xpeke is more of a "bro" to the team than anything. Look at the games in which he was interim manager, and you'll see all the players sans PoE making jokes and laughing. Not saying PoE isn't talented, he just hasn't been able to replicate the bond xpeke has made over the course of the past year and thus the team synergy is weaker with him.
Origen just isn't the same team without xPeke on the stage as a player... until they find someone like him that can fill that void (and PoE isn't that person).
